title: Inverse Trig Function - domain and range

content.question: ​The function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals 1 half sin x"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>sin</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> for <math alttext="negative pi over 2 less or equal than x less or equal than pi over 2"><semantics><mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. What are the domain and range of the inverse function of <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​​Domain: <math alttext="open square brackets negative 1 half comma 1 half close square brackets"><semantics><mfenced close="]" open="["><mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, Range: <math alttext="open square brackets negative pi over 2 comma pi over 2 close square brackets"><semantics><mfenced close="]" open="["><mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​Domain: <math alttext="open square brackets negative 1 , 1 close square brackets"><semantics><mfenced close="]" open="["><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1,1</mn></mrow></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, Range: <math alttext="open square brackets negative pi over 2 comma pi over 2 close square brackets"><semantics><mfenced close="]" open="["><mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​​Domain: <math alttext="open square brackets negative pi over 2 comma pi over 2 close square brackets"><semantics><mfenced close="]" open="["><mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, Range: <math alttext="open square brackets negative 1 half comma 1 half close square brackets"><semantics><mfenced close="]" open="["><mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​​Domain: <math alttext="open square brackets negative pi over 2 comma pi over 2 close square brackets"><semantics><mfenced close="]" open="["><mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, Range: <math alttext="open square brackets negative 1 , 1 close square brackets"><semantics><mfenced close="]" open="["><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1,1</mn></mrow></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​​Domain: <math alttext="open square brackets negative 1 half comma 1 half close square brackets"><semantics><mfenced close="]" open="["><mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, Range: <math alttext="open square brackets negative pi over 2 comma pi over 2 close square brackets"><semantics><mfenced close="]" open="["><mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
